info.title: TWO12 API Reference
info.description:
Note: This API specification is currently alpha. The schema definitions as described are subject to change. New fields or schemas will be added. Please contact support@two12.co for questions or feedback.
The TWO12 API is organized around [REST](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer). Our API has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts and returns [JSON-encoded](http://www.json.org/) request and response bodies, and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs. The TWO12 API may differ for every account as we release new versions and tailor functionality based on customer needs. ## Request Basics ### Headers Currently, this API only communicates with JSON, so in some situations you may need to set `Accept` or `Content-Type` to `application/JSON. TWO12 Technology enables platforms and applications for various organizations and users. To ensure an orderly separation of resource ownership, this API requires tenant identification in all requests. In the request header, set the value `x-tenant-id` to your id. All requests without this value will be rejected with a 401 response.

post.description: Investor will specify whether investing as individual or Entity

304.description: Transfer Requests have been successfully fetched

example.message: Transfer Requests have been successfully fetched

data.description: Our company is engaged in the buying and selling of goods
data.name: BIG Goods Inc

post.description: Create a token for use with the API

OAuth2.description:
TWO12's API implementation only supports [OAuth 2.0](https://OAuth.net/2/) for authentication and authorization. The process to obtain a token is:
  1. TWO12 will deliver a client secret key for each of its Enterprise customers
  2. The Client Application sends an request to the Authorization Endpoint (`/spv/OAuth2/token`) with the client id and client secret in the request body.
  3. In the response, the Authorization Endpoint sends an Access Token (JWT) with a configurable expiry period (default 6 hours).
  4. The Client Application uses the Access Token to call the API endpoints.

address.description:
The address of the applicant

The following characters will be filtered from all fields: `!$%^*=<>`

postalCode.description:
The postcode (ZIP code) of the applicant's address.

- For UK postcodes, specify the value in the following format: `SW4 6EH`.
- For US postcodes, use ZIP format: `84121`

country.description: The full name of the country
enum: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

dateOfBirth.description: The applicant's date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format.

type.description: Type of ID number. Valid values are `ssn`, `social_insurance` (e.g. UK National Insurance), `tax_id`, `identity_card` and `driving_licence`.

value.description:
Value of `type`. 
Type of `ssn` supports both the full SSN or the last 4 digits. If the full SSN is provided then it must be in the format xxx-xx-xxxx.

state.description: Only required for the `driving_licence` type in United States of America

country.description: ISO 3166-1 Full Country name in ISO-639-1 (EN) Format
country.title: Country
enum: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

maximum.title: Maximum
maximum.description: Upper threshold, the most number of EINs that should be available.

ProductCategory.title: ProductCategory
ProductCategory.description:
Generally, product categories group individual products into similar types.  Categories do have specific usage on view and reports that contain categories, e.g. fee and billing statments or invoices. 

<details>
  <summary>Example</summary>

For example (categories **_emphasized_**):

| **_SPV Expenses_** | |
|:--- | ---:|
|       EIN Obtainment: | $49 |

| **_Tax and Accounting Fees_** | |
|:--- | ---:|
|       Tax and K1 Processing: | included |
</details>

name.title: Category Name
name.description: This is the formal name of the category that appears on statements, invoices, etc.

description.title: Category Description
description.description: Category description for additional specification or clarification of the category and its usage

ProductLine.title: ProductLine
ProductLine.description: A product line allows a price list to be assigned and used by a tenant (if included in a contract).  It also converts the internal naming of price lists to a tenant's name for external use.  _Example:_ we have a price list named "Regular Pricing 2022", a tenant could call that price list "Tenant X's Standard Pricing".

name.title: Product Line Name
name.description: This is the name of the product line that the tenant uses to identify the specified price list

NewProductLine.title: NewProductLine
NewProductLine.description:
A product line allows a price list to be assigned and used by a tenant (if included in a contract).  It also converts the internal naming of price lists to a tenant's name for external use.  _Example:_ we have a price list named "Regular Pricing 2022", a tenant could call that price list "Tenant X's Standard Pricing".


 (tsType: Omit<ProductLine, 'id'>, schemaOptions: { title: 'NewProductLine', exclude: [ 'id' ] })

name.description: This is the name of the product line that the tenant uses to identify the specified price list

A product line allows a price list to be assigned and used by a tenant (if included in a contract).  It also converts the internal naming of price lists to a tenant's name for external use.  _Example:_ we have a price list named "Regular Pricing 2022", a tenant could call that price list "Tenant X's Standard Pricing".

QuestionWithRelations.title: QuestionWithRelations
QuestionWithRelations.description:
### Questions

There are two types of questions.  A __basic__ question simply captures the response.  A __scored__ question includes additional fields to calculate a value for the given response.
 (tsType: QuestionWithRelations, schemaOptions: { includeRelations: true })
